customer_reviews.title: Watch out for defects...

customer_reviews.title: Extra gaskets prevent leaks
customer_reviews.text: This was the second shank/tap unit that I purchased recently. The things I like are: One piece construction, there is no nut and barb to connect to the beer line, it is machined from one piece, so no possibilities of leaks. The collar and shank both have a gasket, so you don't have to torque the collar nut onto the faucet to prevent leaking, finger tight is fine. The faucet shuts off cleanly at the end of the pour, no drips. If I expand my keezer beyond two taps, I will be getting more of these faucet/shank kits.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth B. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Installed a keg in my refrigerator and quickly popped on Amazon to get a mounted tap to replace the squeeze tap that came with my keg hosing. Decided on this tap since I was looking for cheap and efficient and I wasn't disappointed. This tap mounts tightly on the fridge wall after punching a similar size hole for it and it fully disassembles for cleaning without having to remove the shaft from the fridge. Handle even unscrews in the event you want to put on a custom handle. No complaints here
